messages.message: I could ask the same about Go :laughing:  the linter has been non-operative for a while
Yeah, I was very surprised to find this too. What happened to go lint? Has it been gone since we moved to bazel @sean.donohoe?
We had it for a while, but we need to make it merge blocking again. Iâ€™m not sure if it stopped working before or after bazel.
It definitely worked pre-bazel. @sean.donohoe is this something we can integrate into bazel? Or was it something we missed adding to the refactored make test commands?
I think another challenge was (maybe?) that golint is deprecated so we have to choose something else.

Hey! I don't recall anything specific coming up with linters during the migration, but I suspect your hypothesis about it being missed in refactored make targets being the likely case @Heymian -- I know we recently enabled goimports in the default vscode config, and I see go-fmt being set as a pre-commit hook here (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L62) :thonk: Might be good for us to lift that into a pre-merge check as well for folks who might not be running pre-commit hooks for whatever reason?
Hrm, this PR it sounds like linting should be happening? https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/56653
